answers.answer: Well it COULD be morning sickness. But yes it's possible you may develop gestational diabetes later. But it's also possible that you're already diabetic. I did my glucose testing at about 5 weeks and I failed which is much too early to have gestational diabetes so I guess I'm actually diabetic without knowing  it! Either way I would get it checked out :)
Should I request a test for it when I go to my doctor?

question: I possted before about being nauseous every time I ate or drink something, I'm about 6-8 weeks along and I'm waiting for my Medicaid for my doctor to see me, I noticed today that I don't  get nauseous when I eat soup or something that has little to no sugar, and I can drink water, I also get dizzy and feel like I'm about to pass out at times.  I've never had gestional diabetes, that I know of so I don't know if there's even any signs or if you can get it this early, but I was curious if it was possible that I could have it?  And if so what could I do until seeing my doctor?  Or could this just be a form of morning sickness?
title: is it possible for gestional diabetes this early?
